column4: *sighs* sometimes I think it would be better to go back to windows
more or less reset the OS
reset? you mean reinstall?
not really - a reset or something to get back to standard without loosing personal data
you can't just "reset" the system
what is the problem?
what makes you think a "reset" which is not really possible would fix that?
3 or more people could fix it
huh?
I don't think a resinstall or "reset" would fix it though
I already know this...
read /msg from ubotu if you didn't
ok
I don't know what's wrong but I doubt a reinstall fixes it unless you really messed something up that broke it.
I don't know if I messed up something. possible
then didn't
you know if you mess around usually
it ist possible that I messed around. I once was able to burn CDs and later I was not anymore... I tried to fix it... maybe I messed up something then
go ahead though I'm not a fan of the "reinstall fix"
I can't reinstall... I can't backup my data
just rename /home then boot a live cd and remove the rest then reinstall without formatting
actually rename /home from the live cd as well
